How do you mount an ISO?: sudo mount -o loop isofile.iso /mnt/point
VLC?
VLC media player
reason is that VLC doesn't handle smb://
whereas Rhythmbox and those other GNOME apps can handle smb://
a workaround would be to mount the SMB share using smbfs
Newbie here. How would i do that? Also what would happen if i turned the windows pc off?
sudo apt-get install smbfs, then sudo mount -t smbfs //ip/share /mnt/point -o lfs,rw
if you turned the PC off while it's mounted, the unmaintained smbfs would kinda just kill itself, thus preventing you from unmounting it for a bit
there probably are better solutions
